user_sentiment: Positive but clarifying—the user interrupts mid-request, suggesting they're refining their original idea rather than rejecting the work. The word 'fine' in follow-up indicates acceptance of what was done, with course correction on scope.
execution_quality: Thorough and methodical execution with good use of planning mode to gather requirements, but the user's incomplete follow-up message suggests potential misalignment on the exact interface design (protocol documentation vs. web dashboard emphasis).
work_category: Architectural planning and initial scaffolding for a protocol-aware web dashboard to visualize agent state and enable message interactions. Agent performed extensive discovery, planning, and code generation to establish a foundation for the feature.
summary: Agent successfully entered planning mode and scaffolded a web dashboard architecture with API documentation, but appears to have overemphasized the demo/dashboard component relative to the protocol documentation interface that the user actually wanted. User's follow-up clarification mid-sentence suggests partial misalignment on whether this should be a generic web viewer or a protocol-specific documentation system. Good recovery and planning discipline, but initial scope reading missed the protocol documentation-first intent.
follow_up_pattern: User is narrowing focus from a general web dashboard to emphasizing protocol documentation as a core feature of the adapter layer. Expects continued refinement of the API/documentation interface rather than full feature implementation.
